reviews.review_msg: Strongly political, very closed minded to things that don't fit his dogmatic, ultra-left view of the world.
Took it online, it was so much unnecessary reading! Exams were fair , assignments not graded fairly at all
I have the highest regard for John. He is quite honestly one of the few profs in the department whose values match what he teaches about. Really made me think!

Not a good experience with his online class. The TA did all the marking, and John didn't even show up for any of the exams. I understand large classes are busy, especially a W class, but I was discouraged by the lack of participation by the prof. The TA had unclear expectations. I wouldn't take a class with him again if this is how he conducts them

John is a very fair, well-meaning, and passionate guy. Lots of films in this class, probably wishes we would participate more & he deserves that tbh. Lectures are basically like extended tutorials- you have to teach yourself the lecture every week with 60pages from his self-written learning module (free!) & extra readings. Better keep up.
One of the best teachers I've ever had. Very democratic. You  have  to read, but the readings are outstanding. I was genuinely sad when the class was over. It changed my life.

I have taken another anthropology class online, and I was hoping for another good experience with this one. However, the class is extremely disorganized. It may not be John's fault, but the TA never got back to students and it took days if she did decide to reply to an email. Assignments are unclear. Best to take in person if possible.

John is such a great professor, he really truly cares. The class is NOT easy... especially the very rigid assignments but this is one of the only classes that makes you think 'critically' and 'independently' as John would say. Make sure you visit him in office hours, he has great advice and is always very nice. You most definitely need the textbook

Took this course as a DE course. The content was interesting and the textbook was relevant. The exam was fair. There is a lot of extra reading because there are no audio lectures. I wouldnt really recommend this as a DE course. Only take it if you need it or have no other choice. He'd probably be better on campus.

Interesting lecturer. Willing to listen to people's opinions even if they differ from his. Learnt a lot in his class. Different way of marking with his critique factor. But is there if you need advise. A lot of reading involved. Class is constructed well. Overall a good prof.

Hands down this is the best learning experience I have ever had, this is what university is all about. I took this class in my last semester and it was easily the best experience I had in my entire undergrad. If you are all about marks, John may not be the guy for you. If you actually care about learning and critical thinking, do not miss SA 498!

Having him as a TA and as a prof is good in the way that if you have any questions it is easier to ask for feedback and help. There is no final and no midterm, just three writing assignments worth 15, 25 and 35% of your grade.  Just remember to incorporate as much course material as possible. Tons of reading though, be prepared for that (:

Critical summaries are only going to marked well if you dont include criticism, just focus on specifically what he details and outlines - thats all. Heavy reading and not well focused - this should be 2 courses. Pleasant man, but dont let that fool you into thinking you have creative wiggle room, especially if your views diverge in any way

I took this course distance ed; HORRIBLY DESIGNED ONLINE, which really isn't John's fault. However, he is incredibly helpful but I do find it quite tedious to fit so much reading content into six pages, double spaced for the annotations. Take his courses in a classroom - he's so much better in person than on Webct! Otherwise, an interesting class!

The readings are generally good but his assignments are tedious. His 'critical summaries' are awful and so is his marking. His marking is inconsistent. Despite all the extra readings, he still relies heavily on the textbook, which is itself pretty horrible. Don't take this course.

In other classes, you don't learn much but get high marks.  In his class, you learn an awful lot but get on average a full letter grade lower than you do in other classes. He gets back at the Capitalist system by punishing his students with lower grades.  Be Warned

Lots of reading, I took this prof before, and everyone was complaining about readings, even my 4th year friend in our 1st year SA class with him! not fun! he is a nice person though! office hours may be limited.
This class has sooooooo much reading and writing. Lectures are really long and boring. He is an okay professor, and the course content is tediously boring. DON'T Take this classs! Please!
Great class! lots of intresting movies, debate and lecture. Prof was amazing and very respectfull of everyone and thier stance on issues. Lots of reading, however its university so get use to it!

His notes are clear and is willing to explain things again if necessary. If you put in the effort on your assignments, you'll do fine. If you really want to get a decent mark on your assignments, make sure you have him as your TA too. Oh and one more thing, go to his office hours often if you are confused on his notes and really need assistance...

Distance Ed. Not a great deal to read but quite a few writing assignments. Grading for these assignments based PURELY on course connections again. He even admits that he is a course connection junkie. Would recommend.

John is very approachable. LOTS of class discussion it can get very interesting. As mentioned, course is based HEAVILY on connections to course material. No test is sweet. Class attendance is MANDATORY if you miss a class you will be left behind (once a week four hour lectures). TONS of reading, make sure you have this in mind. TONS OF READING.

John is a rad guy! His class was interesting even though I dont care about SA at all. There are no tests so it's easy to do well if you're no an idiot. John is a Marxist, but generates good debates. He's open to your ideas, puts on loads of videos, and makes a 4 hr seminar do-able. I enjoyed the class, raised my GPA, and will miss him.

John is the best prof I've ever had. His course was a life changing experience. Interesting, lively, fun, intelligent teacher. Lots of readings, and you can't be flaky on assignments. If you actually try, and you're smart, you'll get an A. Those who criticize him were probably lazy, and didn't really engage with the material in a meaningful way.
I guess he's a pretty intellectual guy who encourages a lot of class discussions. His class was pretty interesting full of videos to watch. Expects quite a lot from assignments, though.
easy to understand...not very challenging though.  very biased, but at least he admits it and so u know how to play along with him

Nothing great about Bogardus. Bias is his middle name. If you are socialist and an extremist you'll enjoy his class. If you have a scintilla of common sense you'll spend your money on different course.
Doesn't care about what you write, just looks at the amount of course material you can relate to the current assignment. It's his way or the highway.

It does not matter what sociology class he teaches;they are all Marxist classes. If you want to do well in them just dance to his tune and you'll get at least a B+. I made it through his socialist non-sense and I got a good grade but it was hell on Earth to listen to his Marxist babble.

Never met him cuz took online course.  Course was heavy with lots of readings but I did quite well and content was very interesting...probing u to think critically.  Next time I will try class setting as communicating online was confusing.  Essay structure works like other SA essay structures (unlike English courses...etc.)

Bogardus was an overall good prof.. he really tries to communicate the material to the students.  the content of this course was interesting as well and he offers videos to help you understand the textbook from different perspectives.  he expects a lot in the assignments.  but all you have to do is try and im sure you'll do fine!

NEVER take this class online!
 Very confusing and time consuming.
 I guess if you take the classroom format it would be ok.
 Enjoyed the material but did not enjoy the way the assignments are structured.
 If you want to do well, include as many quotes as possible in papers.
Best Prof ever! Take him...it will give you the opportunity to prepare and succeed in other courses. I still continue to use his methods as a grad student.
AWESOME PROF!...MY ALTIME FAVORITE!

You either love or hate him.  I found this course frustrating.  While he preaches tolerance for all opinions, he really wants you to agree with his leftist/Marxist interpretation.  The only thing he looks for on written assignments are the NUMBER of quotations.  How is that real evaluation?
Great prof - encourages critical thought and democracy.  Although I heard he was a hard marker - I'm doing ok!
Excellent professor.  He cares about his students.  He encourages critical thought and surprisingly, makes a four hour class enjoyable and exciting!!
Awesome teacher.......inspires you, makes you work hard, challenges you. You can almost say that you never see things the same way after his class.
I'm privileged to have been a student of his. Encouraged us to develop our own ideas and never put us down. Approachable - he'd go out of his way to help us.

I've studied and worked with John and I can say he's one of the best educators I've met. He makes the classroom a democratic space for sharing and is always open to suggestions.He's humble, approachable and really cares about students' growth.
Interesting lectures, articulate, well-organized. Never a dull moment in class. Very personable and always willing to help out students.
Encourages independent thinking. The best thing about him is he is so approachable and respectful.
Good teacher and open to sugestions!

are we talking about the same guy? total time waster, 20 min. to vote about the seating arrangement for the day. WTF? i was dissapointed to see a prof of his feild demonstrate complete disregard for a students cultural tradition. practice what you
best prof i've ever had. easygoing + this is the liveliest class i've taken in my 4 yrs. here.

John's enthusiasm for his subject is infectuous. He's very open and honest, and he genuinely cares about us students. Unlike other instructors I've (unfortunately) had in the Arts department, encourages independent & critical thought.
A remarkable professor. He knows his stuff and he knows how to communicate it. Critical without adopting a leftist platform.
Inspiring and enlightening.  Always speaks with honesty and has respect for everyone - amazing class and prof.  Very open-minded.
John is an extremely kind and helpful prof. He genuinely cares about his students success. Just learn his guidelines on how to  Think Critically  and you'll do well.
Not exactly unfair, just very specific about his writing-style preferences.  Good prof.
He's a really down to earth teacher.  I had lots of fun in his class, and it was eye opening.
good teacher!! always helpful
too left wing
No Comments
blinded by his left wing extremism/ close minded
Unfair marker, wants you to cite where facts are coming from on closed book exam
